title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When I follow the steps in 1GEWMOZ to create a new basic project and add a file named test.xml, the file is opened with the scripted resource editor example by default. However, when I select test.xml in the Navigator and choose 'Open With' -> 'Default Text Editor', nothing happens. It seems that the scripted resource editor is reactivated instead of opening the file with the default text editor. It should open a new editor on the file, considering the different editor types.
EB: When I follow the steps in 1GEWMOZ to create a new basic project and add a file named test.xml, the file is opened with the scripted resource editor example by default. However, when I select test.xml in the Navigator and choose 'Open With' -> 'Default Text Editor', a new editor should open on the file, using the default text editor instead of reactivating the scripted resource editor. This behavior would consider the different editor types.
SR:
1. Create a new basic project.
2. Add a file named test.xml.
3. Observe that the file is opened with the scripted resource editor example by default.
4. In the Navigator, select test.xml.
5. Right-click and choose 'Open With' -> 'Default Text Editor'.
6. Verify that a new editor opens on the file, using the default text editor instead of reactivating the scripted resource editor.
